title: 105_s1716
content:
The Act is titled the "Sonny Bono Memorial Salton Sea Restoration Act" and includes findings related to the restoration project. The "Sonny Bono Memorial Salton Sea Restoration Act" acknowledges the importance of the Salton Sea as an economic and environmental resource, critical for the Pacific flyway, but facing issues like salinity and pollutants affecting migratory waterfowl. It emphasizes the need for remediation efforts with shared responsibility among Federal, State, and local governments. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. The term "Salton Sea Authority" refers to the Joint Powers Authority established under California law in 1993. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Commissioner of Reclamation. SEC. 4. SALTON SEA RESTORATION ACTION PLAN. The Secretary will prepare an action plan for restoring the Salton Sea in California, including a study of remediation alternatives, selection of cost-effective options, and development of a remediation plan to reduce salinity and stabilize the sea's elevation. The action plan for restoring the Salton Sea aims to stabilize its surface elevation, restore habitat and water quality, enhance recreational and economic opportunities, and maintain its use as a reservoir. Options include using impoundments and pumping water out of the sea. The action plan for restoring the Salton Sea includes pumping water out of the sea, augmenting water flow, improving wastewater discharges, implementing feasible remediation options, and limiting options to proven technologies. Factors considered include federal, tribal, state, and local abilities. The action plan for restoring the Salton Sea involves funding sources for construction and operation costs, as well as disposing of pumped water and accumulated salts. The plan will be carried out in accordance with a memorandum of understanding with relevant entities. The action plan for restoring the Salton Sea includes establishing criteria for evaluating and selecting options, with considerations for costs and compliance with reclamation laws. Recommended options will not be subject to certain laws and funds provided will be nonreimbursable and nonreturnable. The action plan for restoring the Salton Sea includes ensuring compliance with water use agreements for the Colorado River. An interim report to Congress will detail findings and recommendations, including options for remediating the Salton Sea. The Secretary will submit a final report to Congress on findings and recommendations of the action plan for remediating the Salton Sea, including a plan to implement the preferred option, cost-sharing recommendations, and completion of environmental compliance activities. Authorization of Appropriations: $30,000,000 is authorized for this section. SEC. 5. SALTON SEA RESTORATION PROJECT. The Secretary has authority to carry out a project for remediating the Salton Sea based on the preferred option recommended in the final report, with an authorization of $300,000,000. SEC. 6. SALTON SEA WILDLIFE RESOURCES STUDIES. The Secretary will enter contracts for studies recommended by the Salton Sea Research Management Committee, including hydrology and wildlife pathology. The Committee will make recommendations on study topics and management. The Secretary will appoint members from various entities to conduct studies in coordination with international bodies, Federal agencies, and California State agencies, including the International Boundary and Water Commission, US Fish and Wildlife Service, EPA, California Department of Water Resources, and California Department of Fish and Game. The Secretary will appoint members from various entities to conduct studies in coordination with international bodies, Federal agencies, and California State agencies. Studies conducted under this section will be subject to peer review. $7,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for this purpose. SEC. 7. The Salton Sea National Wildlife Refuge in California is renamed as the Sonny Bono Salton Sea National Wildlife Refuge. Any references to the old name will now refer to the new one.

SEC. 8. Emergency action is required to stabilize the salinity of the Salton Sea. SEC. 8. If environmental conditions at the Salton Sea require immediate action to stabilize salinity, the Secretary must report to Congress with recommendations and cost estimates for remediation.
